lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau sPl bn ibKY ibrK ibibiD jw ko Plu mITo Kg qwpo cil jwiq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Sadhal Ban Bikhai Birakh Bibidhi , Jaa Ko Dhalu Meettho Khag Taapo Chali Jaati Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a fruit orchard has many types of fruit trees, but birds fly only to the one which has sweet fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy prbq ibKY dyKIAY pwKwn bhu jw mY qo hIrw KojI Koj Knvwrw llcwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Parabat Bikhai Daykheeai Paakhaan Bahu , Jaa Mai To Heeraa Khojee Khoj Khanavaaraa Lalachaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Numerous types of stones are available in the mountains but one in search of diamond longs to see the stone that can yield one a diamond.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau jliD miD bsq AnMq jMq mukqw Amol jwmY hMs Koj Kwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Jaladhi Madhi Basat Anant Janta , Moukataa Amol Jaamai Hans Khoj Khaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a lake is inhabited by many forms of marine life, but a swan visits only that lake which has pearls in its oyster.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srin hY AsMK isK jw mY gur igAwn qwih lok lptwq hY ]366]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Hai Asankh Sikha , Jaa Mai Gur Giaan Taahi Lok Lapataat Hai ?366?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly-numerous Sikhs reside in the refuge of the True Guru. But he who has the knowledge of Guru residing in his heart, people feel attracted and enamoured to him. (366)
